data.text:
Trump’s speech at the National Prayer Breakfast yesterday wasn’t about faith—it was about partisan division and petty grievances.

On Capitol Hill, I joined a bipartisan group of colleagues for a different event where we prayed together for our country and our future.

It’s not enough that this vile, racist video was deleted. I call on my Republican colleagues to condemn this repulsive behavior and for the White House to explain how such hateful garbage was spread on Trump’s account. https://t.co/rT5fC5Izhp
We need to give them ideas they can believe in. https://t.co/I1IBdQFsV1

I delivered Georgetown's Whittington lecture to talk about my positive vision for my party based on opportunity, security, & justice. Young Americans are working harder than ever and still feel they're falling behind their parents.

Republicans love to say—pay attention to what Trump says, not what he does. As the UK, Canada, and the EU move towards China due to Trump's erratic behavior, my new op-ed in @TIME has my advice: it's time to pay attention to what our allies are doing, too.

Read my new op-ed in
Donald Trump's economy: the worst for American workers since the Great Recession. https://t.co/pgRkb2hArA
Millions came here for opportunity. Millions more feel stuck and left behind. If we as Democrats don’t deliver real solutions to that issue, we don’t have a future. https://t.co/XWcxSOVH93

In just three years since my ACT for ALS with @lisamurkowski was signed into law, we managed to TRIPLE federal funding for ALS research. And we won’t stop fighting for more until we find a cure. https://t.co/sicKphQDxf

Every week, I hear from Delawareans whose health insurance bills have skyrocketed—up hundreds or thousands of dollars per month. Families are already suffering under Trump’s economy, and these price hikes are unacceptable. I won’t stop fighting until we have real solutions that

Today is World Cancer Day, a day to remember all those we have lost and all those still fighting this terrible disease. I'm proud to have secured billions of dollars in the 2026 funding bills enacted yesterday that reverse Trump's brutal cuts to medical research, bringing us
